title: Woolworths' loss becomes Air New Zealand's gain
text:
Greg Foran, who missed out on the chief executive job at supermarkets giant Woolworths in 2011 and successfully overhauled Walmart's much-larger American operations, will switch to the aviation industry early next year as the new boss of Air New Zealand.

Mr Foran was born and raised in New Zealand and will return to hs homeland early in 2020 to take the helm as chief executive.

Greg Foran Louie Douvis

At Walmart's American operations he is in charge of 4,600 stores and one million staff. That business is almost five times the size of the Woolworths supermarkets operations for which Mr Foran was widely viewed as a future boss, before being bypassed eight years ago in a recruitment process. He quit Woolworths after missing out, and launched an international business career with Walmart, the world's biggest company by revenue.

Mr Foran is fiercely patriotic and enthusiastic about running Air New Zealand.

"I am an incredibly proud Kiwi and to be given the job of nurturing and building on the legacy of an iconic company that represents the best of our nation at home and around the world really excites me,'' Mr Foran said.
description: Greg Foran was overlooked for the top job at Woolworths in 2011, but overhauled a much bigger business in Walmart's US operations.
